Pre-Game Insights: The Cleveland Guardians and Tampa Bay Rays will play on Saturday at Progressive Field, at 6:10 p.m. ET.
The Rays are +119 moneyline underdogs for this matchup against the favored Guardians (-140).
Cleveland is favored on the run line (-1.5 with +152 odds).
The total for the matchup is set at 8 runs.
Guardians Recent Betting Performance: The Guardians went 4-2 across the six games they were moneyline favorites in their last 10 matchups.
In their last 10 outings (all 10 of them had set totals), the Guardians and their opponents combined to hit the over two times.
The Guardians' ATS record is 5-5-0 over their past 10 games.
Rays Recent Betting Performance: In 10 games over the last 10 matchups when set as underdogs by oddsmakers, the Rays had a record of 5-5.
In their last 10 games with a total, the Rays and their opponents have combined to hit the over three times.
The Rays have won eight of their last 10 games against the spread.
Guardians Recent Stats: The Guardians' best power option comes in the form of Ramirez and his 34-homer 106-RBI season, both team highs.
Ramirez has collected a hit in six games in a row.
Josh Naylor is hitting.242 with 25 doubles, 29 home runs and 54 walks.
Rays Recent Stats: Diaz leads the Rays with 65 runs batted in while accumulating a team-high batting average of.284.
Diaz has collected a hit in five games in a row.
Christopher Morel has shown off his power as he leads his team with 21 home runs.
